questions.question: An ___projection is one that preserves direction for all straight lines passing through a single, specified point.

explanations.a: A conformal projection is a map projection that favors preserving the shape of features on the map but may greatly distort the size of features.
explanations.b: A Equidistant projection maintains scale along one or more lines, or from one or two points to all other points on the map
explanations.c: Correct Answer.  A map projection in which a globe, as of the Earth, is assumed to rest on a flat surface onto which its features are projected.
explanations.d: Azimuthal projection is one that preserves direction for all straight lines passing through a single, specified point.

questions.question: All easting values east and west of the central meridian will be____.

explanations.d: All easting values east and west of the central meridian will be Positive.
